A fun game that synthesizes gameplay and story.

The flagship of the Valve company's cataloge of games. Half-Life was the game that push the boundaries of first person shooter games. It even helped Valve get to where it is today which paved away for other games Valve is known for. Half-Life takes at the Black Mesa Research Facility(a combination of Area 51 & the Los Alamos National Lab)  in the middle of the desert of New Mexico. As the  game begins there's no FMVs, cutscenes, or introduction sequence. You immidiately start the game in the role of Gordon Freeman, a Theoretical Physict who works for Black Mesa. When Gordon participates in an experiment with a group of other scientists, something went wrong and the entire research lab explodes. Upon waking up, Gordon realizes that the Black Mesa facility is in ruins where most of the staff is dead and the experiment gone wrong had some how created a gateway from another demonsion where various aliens and other horrific creatures straight out of every man's horror is running amok in the facility. Gordon must use his intellect, brawn, and the help of the last surviving scientists and security guards in order to escape from Black Mesa before he gets mutilated by the demonsional aliens. The great thing about this game is that there are multiple ways to kill the enemies with the wide selection of weapons you obtain around the lab facility. There are unlimited saves so in case you mess up you can either reload the last save or auto save of the game file. Those are just a few of the many pros of the game. Now for the cons which are minor: the ladders can be you worst enemy some times due to getting on or off is tricky, the scientists and guards who provide aid sometimes don't keep up or move at all, while you occasionally encounter a glitch that immobilze you from moving and you either have to reload you last save or quit the game and start it up again just to get out of the glitch. With those issues aside, this is an extremely good game to play. While todays gamers might find the graphics to be very dated, the complex plot and the length of the game play by passes its age. Half-Life would spawn various spin-offs and sequals as well is inspire later first person shooter games that used this game as a basis for the genre. Overrall this is a great piece of video game history here with a story that combines elements from Doom, Ridley Scott's Alien, John Carpenter's The Thing, & X-Files into one package will please any gamer or first person shooter fan.

This game aged very well and was fun to pick up and play again. Not really too many glitches to speak of. Only dislike is a certain enemy weapon that has homing round that will follow you down a hallway and around multiple corners. I streamed this on hard, the difficulty mechanics weren't too bad. It didn't make enemies SUPER spongey. All around good game that changed FPS's in a big possitive way when it came out. I definitely recommend grabbing the series!

This is clearly the best game ever. I have had 0.2 hrs last two weeks (cuz am busy) / 132.8 hrs on record on this game. It's got no cutscenes nor a speaking protaginist, so why not spend the money? 
Yes it has cheap graphics, but is is worth the money. I enjoy playing Team DeathMatch (there is also DeathMatch) on several servers and with my friends. You are Gordon Freeman, and you are late for work. You have to get to Black Mesa, get your special suit on, and do a experiment. The experiment is anylyzing a VERY SPECIAL crystal from another diemnsion called The Border World (a.k.a. Xen). Bet that experiment goes wrong. You have opened a portal between Xen and Earth. Your aim is to travel to Xen, kill the boss who is keeping the portal open and free Earth.

Me - 10/10 - Awesome!
IGN - 9.5/10 - Amazing
IGN Community - 9.1/10 - Amazing

In my opinion this game is the best of the series in almost every aspect. The graphics are not better than Half-Life 2, but the weapons are the best. The hive hand and tao cannon are the most fun and satisfying to use. The story is dark and I am fond of it for portraying you as a small cog in a larger machine through which you slowly climb the ranks until the entire military is hounding you, as oppose to Half-Life 2 where you are regarded as the new messiah. You have much more free reign in Half-Life than Half-Life 2 as you have the ability to shoot anything/one who look at you funny. The puzzels are challenging and require skill, but are never flow breaking. It is extremely replayable because the action is never boring. The difficulty curve is fair yet firm and never becomes too steep. The enemies are never too hard to defeat but are interesting and better than the Half-Life 2 villains. The colour scheme and art design are fantastic and make up for the outdated graphics.

There are afew annoyances, all the scientists are clones and the game does become slightly easy after the Hive Hand is introduced and Black Mesa seens to have 13,000 generators, but these are the small moles on the beautiful bearded face of this classic game. 

This game is amazing and everyone should purchase it to show VALVe we want Half-Life 3.
Some may disagree, but this game is just marvelous.

Gordon Freeman-ünk elkésett a melóból, ezért rá hárul a feladat, hogy a teszt kamrában ténykedjen az új kísérletben. Mint utóbb kiderült, jobban járt volna ha be se megy a melóba, hiszen a teszt során elszabadul a pokol. Egy másik dimenzióban levő lény egy portált hoz létre kedvenc Föld nevű bolygónkkal, és elárasztja mindenféle hangos, büdös, és felettébb agresszív lénnyel. A melóhelyen rajta kívűl csak impotens biztonsági őrök, és 70 fölötti tudósok vannak, így Freeman barátunkra marad a feladat, hogy kiírtsa az önkényuralomra törő élien bandát.

A játék 1998-ban jelent meg, és többségében ürlényhentelés lesz a terítéken. Azonban amivel kitűnt a játék a többi közül, az a viszonylag hihető környezet, a technológia, valamint a cseles platformer részek.

Nézzük csak az enemiket és fegyvereket: vegyesen fogunk találkozni képzett katonákkal, és más dimenziók lényeivel. A katonák néha okosan mozognak, néha pedig bután fognak állni a placc közepén. Ami viszont mindig közös lesz bennük, hogy mindig csapatban mozognak, és marhasok hpjuk van. Ezt azzal akarták kompenzálni a valve-nél, hogy ráadásul pontosan lőnek, és gránátokat is dobálnak. A többség utálja őket emiatt, és mindig is rátett a játék nehézségi fokozatára a katonaság. MIt mondjak, most végigtoltam hardon, és egy egészséges kihívás volt a játék.
Az élienek lassúak és kevésbé koordináltak embertársaikhoz képest. Hátrányuk viszont, hogy bárhova bespawnolhatnak, így vigyázzunk a hátsónkra (főleg folyosókon).

Maguk a pályák hihetőek, és mindenki így képzel el egy titkos kutatóközpontot, ahol öreg tudósok kísérleteznek kristályokon és tesztelgetik az elkapott űrlényeket. Talán ami meglepő, az a központ mérete. Kilómétereken át megyünk a játékban, és még mindig a lambda részlegen vagyunk.
Másik meghatározó rész a xen, avagy a másik dimenzió. Itt nem töltünk el annyi időt, viszont egy maradandó élmény lesz, hiszen egy számunkra ismeretlen világba csöppenünk. Minden lebeg, minden meg akar harapni vagy rázni, és ez tovább fokozódik amikor megtaláljuk a katonagyártó bázisukat. Tetszett, hogy láttuk néha elhullott társainkat. Az elhullott társ régebben (pl Doom-ban) azt jelentette hogy erős ellenállásba fogunk ütközni, itt azonban mint ammo állomásként szerepeltek.

A fent említett technológia egyébként a Quake 2 motorjára épül, azonban itt könnyebb mindent módosítani. Ilyen például a csontvázszerkezet, ahol elég a fejet kicserélni, hogy egy másik tudóst kapjunk. Ez egy a mai napig aktív mod scene-t teremtett. Ahogy láthatjátok nem régiben jelent meg steamen a sven coop is, mellyel egyébként végig lehet tolni a gémet haverokkal coopban.

A játék azonban küszködik a klasszikus régi játék szindrómákkal: egyes platformok megölnek, levegőben random sebződsz, és a mesterséges intelligencia...nos ez szimplán csak szörnyű. Perceken át nyomogatni az E betűt hogy ugyan méltóztasson követni a biztonsgi őr és nyissa ki a tetves ajtót. Az AI egyébként az utóbbi évek patchelésének hatására sem javult, még megkockáztatom, hogy a won verzióban jobb volt.

Ami viszont jó hír, hogy a steames verzió jól fut modern rendszereken, SŐT kapott egy deafult_fov és fps_override parancsokat, így akármekkora fovval kitolhatjuk temérdek képkockaszámmal. Végeredményben egy jó játékról van szó, aminek el kell nézni sok mindent korából kifolyólag.
Értékelés: 8/10 trancsírozott óriás heregolyó, ami egy négy lábú szörnyről lóg.

I know that this is a crime, but I have only just for the first time completed Half-Life! I know right! But hey, I have never been one to really be on top of anything lol :-P
Anyway, the question is, is it any good? Now this is a bit of a redundant question as the whole of the world is fairly clear on this point. But I have just played it without nostalgia goggles, so maybe my opinion can be slightly less biased than some.
First off, the plot. Simply put, amazing. It is told - or rather not "told", but "revealed" - in a wonderfully immersive and instructive way, guiding you to self-discovery and your own interpretations of everything. There is a lot of wry humour and thoughts and considerable depth to the whole concept.
Second off, the characters. There is only one, and he is not even you. Gordon Freeman, the player character, is almost entirely devoid of depth - but that is not a bad thing. It is one of the game's strengths, as it allows a huge amount of player imagination to be used, and he is a perfect everyman in this sense. The one character I am talking about is a mysterious figure you see at various times...I leave anyone who has not played the game the mystery of this figure.
Third, the enemies. A diverse array of challenging enemies, with designs that may now be called standard, and even then were not the most original, but nonetheless they work and are used in one of the most effective ways I have seen even up to the present.
Fourth, the weapons. A variety of weapons, although not the most exciting array ever. Most of them feel plinky and weak, and the worst is the shotgun which seems to have b****r-all pellet spread, meaning the main use for a shotgun is rendered near-impossible to carry out. The exceptions are the ghostbuster gun (or Gluon as it is actually called), the Magnum Revolver, and the crossbow.
Fifth, the level design. Pretty good on the whole. There is a reasonable amount of variety overall, but a lot of it will be in dull corridors. That is the point, however, so it is not fair to criticise. There is a hideous over-reliance on single-routes to solve levels, and a dreadful over-utilisation on platforming elements which do not work comfortably within the dated engine and first-person perspect.
This leads on to the sixth aspect, gameplay. This is where the game is a mixed bag of fruit. It may have been wonderful for its day, but that is not the point. A game can be good at one point and become bad over time if the gameplay does not hold up - it is not something that is forgivable in the same way dated graphics are. Ladders are a joke, with your character either stuck inseperably to them or refusing to grab them when needed. Jumping and platforming, as mentioned before, is used far too much and is, honestly, hideous. A modern FPS with feet shown on your character, may be more tolerable. The shooting is functional, although as mentioned the weapons are not that satisfying or varied. The crosshair is also coloured and sized to be far too small and hard to decipher on the screen in the middle of the chaos. There is the suggestion of being able to be more stealthy, and this works well enough for a shooter of its generation, especially when stealth is unnecessary and who needs it lol?
Finally, atmosphere. This is where the game really comes in to its own. It is creepy when it needs to be, and it is dark, and deep, and rich. It can be scary, and sometimes you cannot help but jump. It is tense and action-packed, unrelenting, and surprisingly beautiful despite the dated graphics.
I will not even mention the graphics, as I maintain someone that judges a game on its graphics is not a real gamer at all, and such opinions deserve no time of day, as long as the graphics are functional (i.e., if they constantly crash or flicker so as to give a migraine that is obviously bad, but merely being blocky and pixellated or something is not important).
Overall, just buy this game. I give it a solid 8.5/10, even by today's standards.
Enjoy!

I give this game a 8.5/10 overall. 

-The "story" is great even there is lack of information. The story is that a experiment goes wrong which opens a portal and aliens destroy the whole facility, the player needs to kill aliens and close the portal to save the day.

-The gamplay is for me 7.5/10 because sometimes the directions are unclear and what you need to do is sometimes hard to understand. For example I got to a area which had many enemies and very little health packs, I found myself frustrated dying over and over again. in the same area a npc got stuck in a door and he needed to help me open a door (where health packs and ammo was found in), I had to consult a online guide to understand what I needed to do. Sometimes I got stuck in objects and sometimes the game crashed.

-The graphics are "bad" (by todays standards) but dosent affect the gameplay, I really didnt notice the fact that they are "bad" and still enjoyed the game.

-Otherwise I think the game is great and I highly recommend it to people a great game.

[h1][u]A classic with its flaws[/u]. [b]9/10[/b][/h1]

[h1][b]Summary[/b][/h1] 
Half-life is a story-rich shooter with some simple puzzle elements that struggles with the Goldsource engine and some other glitches here and there.

[h1][b]Detailed review[/b][/h1]
So I just finished Half-life and figured: "Why not make a review of it?". I can't say other than it's a classic. What a game indeed!

Dispise being an alltime masterpiece, it's not safe from glitches and mistakes. This game runs with the old but gold (no pun intended) Goldsource engine, which has its limitations (like crude-to-use ladders). Throughout the game you're sure to find some glitches here and there. You might get stuck on walls or levers. Also, sometimes the submachine gun MP5 won't reload or might reload but won't show to you (though it reloads, your HUD view won't update your bullets). Those are some of the glitches you may run into.

"GOTTA GO FAST". I think that's Freeman's motto. His speed is way too fast and, because of that, often you might fall off platforms.

This game is hard. Most people will agree. Enemies take bullets like if they are nothing and they lock onto you like some freaking aimbot! They never miss a shot! And if your HEV meter is gone, you're pretty much gone too because they can drain your life faster than you can say: "what the...!". It's trial and error at its best!

One other thing: this game requires English knowledge as intermediate or above. People who can't handle English properly might struggle. If you don't pay attention, often you might find yourself wondering what to do next. (Just a fair warning!)

Though there're all those issues, Half-life has that special charm that makes you want to keep going. You may have to try the same area a lot of times until you become a master on it, but you keep trying because you are in love with the story and wants to know what comes next. The plot is amazing.

The overall scenario presentation is alright. Some places are awesome and some are bland. Overall, it's OK.

I can't make enough justice about this game. It's a must play for everyone who likes shooters and simple puzzle-solving elements. Story-rich at its finest. Though, be warned: it's not an easy game.

Oh, by the way, Freeman is a crowbar master!

Lo que hizo grande a la industria de los videojuegos, fue lo que Half-Life logró al mezclar historia con acción en la que el jugador estaba al tanto de lo que sucedía, y aunque algunos piensen que este juego está sobrevalorado y que ya no es lo de antes, nunca sabran lo que es ni lo que fue para las personas que perseguían el sueño de crear su propio juego y que hoy en día son existosos.

Still waiting for 3.
Very good from what I have played. The only thing I have to say bad about it is there is an occasional glitch making it impossible to move, Other than that it is a great game. 9/10

Ahh... Esse jogo
Esse jogo fez história, meus amigos. Pelo menos na minha vida ele não passou despercebido.
Ao lado de classicos como Unreal, Half-life fez parte da minha infancia assim como vários outros jogos.
Revolucionário, eu diria. O grande começo da Valve e a ficção científica fodona envolvida nos jogos.

Half-life é incrivél. E para quem curte uma história interessante em jogos classicos, eu recomendo muito!
